bibl.title: Letter from Henry R. Muller to Frederick F. Russell, May 19, 1924

div1.p: Muller sends Russell the pathology reports from West African fever cases.

div1.head: Letter from Henry R. Muller to Frederick F. Russell, May 19, 1924
div1.opener:
Copy.
THE ROCKEFELLER INSTITUTE
FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH
66th St. and Ave. A
New York.
May 19, 1924.
Dear Dr. Russell-
div1.p:
The enclosed report on the material*
from West Africa gives, in the last column on the
right, the probable diagnosis in each case. Where
the description of an organ is not given it means that
that tissue was not received. The cases of 1923,
especially, appear quite definitely to be yellow fever.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, (Signed) Henry R. Muller. *Material sent to Dr. Noguchi. Letter in re from
G. J. Pirie, for Director of Medical and Sanitary
Services, Accra, Gold Coast, West Africa, August
21, 1923.
